Cell.Data: A documentation of healthcare-related information that is assembled together into a single statement of meaning that establishes its own context. A document is composed of a set of resources that include both human and computer readable portions. A human may attest to the accuracy of the human readable portion and may authenticate and/or sign the entire whole. A document may be kept as a set of logically linked resources, or they may be bundled together in an atom feed

While the focus of this specification is on patient-specific clinical documents, this resource can also apply to other healthcare-related documents such as study protocol designs, healthcare invoices and other activities that are not necessarily patient-specific or clinical
Logical Identifier for the document, assigned when created. This identifier stays constant when subsequent versions of the document are created
see discussion in resource definition for how these relate
Version specific identifier for the document, assigned when created. This identifier changes when subsequent versions of the document are created
see discussion in resource definition for how these relate

The document creation time, when the document first came into being. Where the document is a transform from an original document in some other format, the ClinicalDocument.effectiveTime is the time the original document is created.
Creation time is used for tracking, organizing versions and searching.
The code specifying the particular kind of document (e.g., Prescription, Discharge Summary, Report).

It is suggested that the XDS Affinity Domain draws these values from a coding scheme providing a coarse level of granularity (about 10 to 100 entries). Shall have a single value. This should be an extension
Specifies the particular kind of document (e.g. History and Physical, Discharge Summary, Progress Note)
Key metadata element describing the document, used in searching/filtering.
Official human-readable label for the document
Helps humans to assess whether the document is of interest

It's commonly the case that clinical documents do not have a title and are collectively referred to by the display name of Document.type (e.g. a "consultation" or "progress note"). Where these display names are rendered to the clinician or where the document has a unique title, the Document.title value should be used
The source of the data entry
The person or device that performed the data entry leading to this document. Where there is more than one candidate, pick the most proximal to the document creation or capture on a per-section basis.
Identifies who is responsible for the entry of the data.
Can provide other enterers in extensions

unique(highest(./participation[typeCode="INT" and isNormalParticipation], priorityNumber)/role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole]/player[determinerCode="INST" and classCode=("DEV", "PSN") and isNormalEntity()])
The code specifying the level of confidentiality of the XDS Document. These codes are specific to an XDS Affinity Domain.

Enforcement and issues related to highly sensitive documents are beyond the scope of XDS (see security section). confidentialityCode is part of a codification scheme and value set enforced by the Document Registry.
Identifies the primary subject of the document.
Essential metadata for searching for the document, identifies who the document applies to
For clinical documents, this is usually the patient.

unique(./participation[typeCode="SBJ" and isNormalParticipation]/role[typeCode="PAT"]) or unique(./participation[typeCode="SBJ" and isNormalParticipation]/role[typeCode="IDENT"]/player[determinerCode="INST" and classCode=("DEV", "ORG") and isNormalEntity()])
Need to extend this to support documents with other types of subjects. Also rationalize with visit & context elements
Identifies the source that recounted the information recorded
Provides context as to the potential accuracy of the information
Generally used if information is sourced from a non-clinician (patient, relative, etc.)

unique(highest(./participation[typeCode="INF" and isNormalParticipation], priorityNumber)/role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole]/player[determinerCode="INST" and classCode=("DEV", "PSN") and isNormalEntity()])
Identifies who is responsible for the information in the document. (Not necessarily who typed it in.)
Identifies who is responsible for the content.
A participant who has attested to the accuracy of the document
Identifies responsibility for the accuracy of the document content.
The type of attestation the authenticator offers
Indicates the level of officialness of the attestation.
When document was attested by the party
Identifies when the information in the document was deemed accurate. (Things may have changed since then.)
Who attested the document in the specified way
Identifies who has taken on the responsibility for accuracy of the document content.

./role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole]/player[determinerCode="INST" and classCode=("DEV", "PSN") and isNormalEntity()] or ./role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole and not(player)]/scoper[determinerCode="INST" and classCode="ORG" and isNormalEntity()]
Identifies the people and organisations for whom the document is intended
Used for routing and also provides context as to intended audience.

./participation[typeCode="RCV" and isNormalParticipation]/role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole] or ./participation[typeCode="RCV" and isNormalParticipation]/role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole and not (player)]/scoper[classCode="ORG" and determinerCode="INST" and isNormalEntity()]
Identifies the organization or group who is responsible for ongoing maintenance of and access to the document.
Identifies where to go to find the current version, where to report issues, etc.
./participation[typeCode="RCV" and isNormalParticipation]/role[classCode="CUST" and isNormalRole and not (player)]/scoper[classCode="ORG" and determinerCode="INST" and isNormalEntity()]
The main event/act/item, such as a colonoscopy or an appendectomy, being documented
Provides context for the document and creates a linkage between a resource describing an event and the document created describing the event.
The event needs to be consistent with the type element, though can provide further information if desired
Code(s) that apply to the event being documented

This list of codes represents the main clinical acts, such as a colonoscopy or an appendectomy, being documented. In some cases, the event is inherent in the typeCode, such as a "History and Physical Report" in which the procedure being documented is necessarily a "History and Physical" act.

An event can further specialize the act inherent in the typeCode, such as where it is simply "Procedure Report" and the procedure was a "colonoscopy". If one or more eventCodes are included, they shall not conflict with the values inherent in the classCode, practiceSettingCode or typeCode, as such a conflict would create an ambiguous situation. This short list of codes is provided to be used as “key words” for certain types of queries.
The period covered by the document
The period of time covered by the document. There is no assertion that the document is a complete representation for this period, only that it documents events during this time
Full details for the event(s) the document concents
Full details for the event(s) the document concents
Describes the clinical visit or type of care this document is associated with.
Provides context for the document and supports searching.
unique(highest(./outboundRelationship[typeCode="SUBJ" and isNormalActRelationship()], priorityNumber)/target[moodCode="EVN" and classCode=("ENC", "PCPR") and isNormalAct])
Identifies the document this document supersedes, if any.
Used to establish relationships between documents to determine which is the most current/authoritative.
This is labelled as "Is Modifier" because applications must be aware of document replacement semantics and behave appropriately

unique(highest(./outboundRelationship[typeCode="RPLC and isNormalActRelationship()], priorityNumber)/target[classCode="DOC" and moodCode="EVN" and isNormalAct]/id[isNormalDatatype() and displayable="false" and scope="OBJ" and reliability="ISS"])
The source of the data entry
The person or device that performed the data entry leading to this document. Where there is more than one candidate, pick the most proximal to the document creation or capture on a per-section basis.
Identifies who is responsible for the entry of the data.
Can provide other enterers in extensions

unique(highest(./participation[typeCode="INT" and isNormalParticipation], priorityNumber)/role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole]/player[determinerCode="INST" and classCode=("DEV", "PSN") and isNormalEntity()])
Additional provenance about the document and it's parts
Additional provenance about the document and the resources that are the sections
Stylesheet to use when rendering the document
A fixed CSS stylesheet to use when rendering the documents
An alternative representation of the document that can be used in place of the html based rendering
Identifies a main topic within the document's table of contents
Adds organization and human navigability to the information in the document.
A code identifying the kind of content contained within the section
Provides computable standardized labels to topics within the document.
Identifies when the content of the section was created
Sections are often re-used in several documents, thus the creation time of a section may differ from that of the document
Identifies who is responsible for the information in the section. (Not necessarily who typed it in.)
Identifies who is responsible for the content.
./participation[typeCode="AUT" and isNormalParticipation]/role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole]/player[determinerCode="INST" and classCode=("DEV", "PSN") and isNormalEntity()]
The source of the data entry
The person or device that performed the data entry leading to this section. Where there is more than one candidate, pick the most proximal to the document creation.
Identifies who is responsible for the entry of the data.
Can provide other enterers in extensions

unique(highest(./participation[typeCode="INT" and isNormalParticipation], priorityNumber)/role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole]/player[determinerCode="INST" and classCode=("DEV", "PSN") and isNormalEntity()])
Identifies the primary subject of the section.
Subjects can vary within one document, for example mother/baby, patient & relatives, etc.
This is labelled as "Is Modifier" because applications must be aware if the subject changes for a particular section

unique(./participation[typeCode="SBJ" and isNormalParticipation]/role[typeCode="PAT"]) or unique(./participation[typeCode="SBJ" and isNormalParticipation]/role[typeCode="IDENT"]/player[determinerCode="INST" and classCode=("DEV", "ORG") and isNormalEntity()])
Identifies the source that recounted the information recorded
Provides context as to the potential accuracy of the information
Generally used if information is sourced from a non-clinician (patient, relative, etc.)

unique(highest(./participation[typeCode="INF" and isNormalParticipation], priorityNumber)/role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole]/player[determinerCode="INST" and classCode=("DEV", "PSN") and isNormalEntity()])
The actual data for the section
Identifies the discrete data that provides the content for the section.
Conveys the discrete data associated with the document.
Because documents represent point-in-time snapshots, resource references should generally be to a specific version.
This may need to be 0..*. May need to consider adding text here to to account for missing resources.
Human Readable Text Summary of the section
Provides the text view of the section.
This will most commonly be used when there is no "content" resource or when the content resource does not provide a "text" element.
Identifies a subtopic within the section as part of the document's table of contents
A section must have content or one or more sections, but not both.
A document must have a representation, one or more sections or both
A document stylesheet must have a mime type of text/css
Classification of a clinical document section
The way in which a person authenticated a document
Codes specifying the level of confidentiality of the XDS Document
The person authenticated the document in their personal capacity
The person authenticated the document in their professional capacity
The person authenticated the document and accepted legal responsibility for its content
The organization authenticated the document as consistent with their policies and procedures
